_comment: Created by ianb on 01/08/2014 12:33:45 using v2.1
title: How have perceptions of outpatient toilets cleanliness changed?
analysis_commentary: Though patients' opinions on the cleanliness of outpatient toilets are not as good as of those on outpatient department in general, the majority of patients surveyed in 2011 report that in their opinion the outpatient toilets were either 'very clean' or 'fairly clean' (95%) and 2011 saw the largest percentage of patients saying that they found the outpatient toilets 'very clean' (60%) over all the surveys.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients and Survey of Outpatients
